This study analyses the vulnerability faced by Indian banks during COVID19 using marginal expected shortfall of stocks return as a measure. Firms who took loans from vulnerable banks, after the COVID-19 outbreak experienced a significantly lower crash risk compared to firms who took loans from non-vulnerable banks.
